reviewText: I really enjoyed this workout.  I do a lot of weight training and Tae Bo, so I wanted something a bit more feminine that would still work up a sweat.  This was it!  The dancers are regular people, the rhythm is contagious, and even though it takes doing it a few times to get the moves down, it's worth the effort.  The reason I gave it four stars instead of five is that it doesn't burn as many calories as Tae Bo, and I would like to find a dance-based workout that does.  However, even if you're a beginner, this is a great cardio workout!
Title: N/A

reviewText: i love this dvd!! i have been latin dancing for years, never daring to actually get a dance workout dvd.  i am glad i found this one. if you are looking to learn dance moves to use in a club, this isn't for you. but, if you want to find a great workout that combines a little history and culture into one routine, this may be it.  i do this dvd with tahitian cardio or yoga to get an even better workout.  but truthfully, this dvd will give you a dancers abs. i really love it!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I work out daily with a variety of workouts from more strenuous cardio works out to Pilates and Yoga but one of my favorite workouts is anything dance related.  This looked fun and it is!  If you have done dance type work outs before you will recognize some of the types of steps and after a time or two will have the routine down.  I enjoy the percussion and the steps.  Only a couple draw backs, the instructional segment slows you down a bit after you have already mastered the moves, it is too bad you couldn't have a section that you could learn the moves first and then go to the routine and be uninterrupted by half tempo moves.  The other area is the head rolls during the warm up.  NEVER a good idea to roll your head to the back in a full circle.  This grinds your disks at your neck together.  Skip that step and just do the rolls to the front and side.  Other than that, it is a fun workout where you can really gear it to your own pace.  It is not a heartpounding cardio workout, but you do get your heart rate up if you are putting some ooomph in the moves.  I would definitely recommend this one for a nice change of pace and especially for those who love dance workouts!
summary: Get up and move your body!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have over 50 exercise Videos & DVD's and this one is the best! The great instructor & brazilian music (live band) are upbeat & really makes you want to move! Vannessa breaks down the moves so that they are learnable and then goes through them in a set together. Before I knew it I was able to dance, (even with my two left feet). It's also terrific because the participants in the video are normal everyday people. I would recommend this workout to people that want to be entertained and have fun while they work out. Also, this video worked muscles I didn't realize needed working out. I hope they make more videos like this.
summary: This workout is exciting and motivating

reviewText: I really just recommend this workout wholeheartedly.  It's helped me with my samba moves, and it's just a lot of fun.  If you want to make it even harder, you can run in place or jump rope (or bounce from side to side, which makes sense given the music) in between segments, when she is breaking things down at a very slow pace (which is a good thing, actually, her cueing is excellent).Overall fantastic DVD, and I LOVE the Santa Barbara setting.

reviewText: I have wanted to learn that tricky Samba step ever since I went to visit cousins in Brazil years ago. I came away with a love of Brazilian music and dance, but I never was able to pick up that samba step--I'm not much of a dancer. Here is a workout tape with something to aim for; not only fitness, but learning those appealing dance routines from Carnival.The tape begins with a longish warm up; a good idea as Brazilian dance, based on African style moves, requires you use EVERY part of your body. So you, like me, may not have moved some of those parts for quite a while. You shake your arms, roll your head, contract and roll the back and do hip swivels, and plenty of shoulder moves, too. The warm up is possibly a sufficient workout for someone very unfit or elderly, in fact.The first dance sequence is done at half-tempo--but, here's my problem. The first step is not explained (a cross and back) but the easier back undulation at the end IS given instruction. Sure, some people have trouble undulating their spine, but the footwork also needed a bit of elucidation. Still, you can replay that part of the DVD til you get it--but it's a bit of a nuisance not to have a different camera angle or a talk-through. So plan on stopping and starting the DVD as you learn these steps before you can get a non-stop Samba workout.This workout is particularly excellent for back flexibility. And on that note, if you do hAVE back problems, you might have difficulties with the upper body parts of this workout so consider your own limitations.The filming is a bit dull--outdoors in a field with palm trees on a portable parquet dance floor. The usual "one from every kind" dance troupe of elderly, young, thin, plump, dark, light is included to make the viewer feel included. But the camera stays at a boring same distance. I wanted some more close ups and perhaps some alternate camera angles as well.The music is drums and bells, typical samba rhythm, and very pleasant.Summary: if you want a fun, dance workout, plan on spending some time learning the moves and then enjoy a very thorough, body-moving dance session.
summary: Actually teaches you Brazilian dance while you work out

reviewText: This was one of the craziest workouts I have tried.  I am tired just thinking about it.  That being said however, if you are a person who never finds a workout that is  spastic enough then this is your DVD!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I had previously tried Vanessa Isaac's "Brazilian Rhythym Celebration" - which was an excellent beginner workout and didn't require a particularly flexible or aerobically fit body to use; this was a whole other ball game!  I was pleasantly surprised. Challenging, fun moves, added together quickly, which you can do at your own level and intensify as you get better, but always require a lot more concentration, listening, watching, and hard work to do right.  There is a lot of back and core work here, so ease into it - if you're not used to using those muscles, as I imagine most Americans are not, you could really, really hurt yourself. But if you start small and work up, this will be a refreshing new way of working out and will definitely make you sweat. An earlier poster complained about the simplicity of the angles - in my case, I was REALLY glad it always gave me the whole-body movement, since Brazilian dance moves always use the whole, whole body and it kept me in good form.  And - hey, since there's no reason one can't have fun while watching - there's an amazing male dancer who was just incredible to watch - both because he was awfully good-looking (!) and because his movement was just a little different than the female dancers.  Makes you want to race out to a samba party!
Title: N/A

reviewText: i am always hesitant to buy new workout videos. for the past 3 yrs or better my shcedule has not allowed me to go to a gym, but people always think i do, because i am in very good shape. i have been doing tae bo for yrs now and have yet to find something as challenging and well rounded as this. this is a fun video, i was hesitant as i said but once i got into it, i was glad i got it. from someone who works out everyday, i can honestly say i had a good fast heartrate going and it was a truly intense cardio workout. if you are a beginner or dont feel you catch on quick to moves in workout videos this may be a little bit difficult. i had no real trouble. they dont give you much going over the steps at a slow pace, usually once or twice, but for me that was enough. its fun to put the moves together, and it was a completely different change from the workouts im used to. some of the users who reviewed have suggested its only a way to learn dance or didnt break a sweat, but i disagree. i always work out, and if you follow this instead of watch it, you will be getting something out of it. muito bem!!!!
summary: a wonderful workout and very fun!!!!!!!!!!!

reviewText: This DVD is tremendous fun. The instructor breaks down the moves to half-time a few times before we join in at full-time, giving instruction but also keeping the workout challenging. She also explains the ritual significance of a few steps, which I enjoy.I only gave this 4 stars because I can't do the samba section--it involves a lot of jumping and I live in a second floor condo! So I only feel qualified to review the first half of the DVD, the Afro-Brazilian dance section. I'd bet the samba is fun, too, though.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Brazilian Dance Workout is a high-energy cardio-workout DVD for all fitness levels, inspired by the exciting rhythms of Brazilian dance. Samba, Samba Reggae, Axe, African and Frevo moves blend in an energizing routine, led by Brazilian dance and fitness instructor Vanessa Isaac. Bonus audio tracks include a Brazilian percussion mix and the "Hip Brazil" theme by Randy Tico. An enthusiastically toe-tapping addition to personal fitness library and exercise routine DVD shelves, highly recommended for men and women of all ages looking for motivation to get moving and healthy. 60 min., color.
summary: An energizing routine, led by Brazilian dance and fitness instructor Vanessa Isaac

reviewerName: Ohh Mama "I'm trying to help you."
reviewText: What I liked:- The Instructor breaks things down for you at a slow pace.- The people in this video are really diverse among ethnicities and body types.- It reminded me a bit of modern dance (on top of the African Dance that the instructor mentions this exercise is mixed with)- I can do it before or after my usual workout or in combination with other workouts.- It's a very light workout.  It gets my heart rate up a little more than yoga.. but nothing too intense.- I can focus on my muscles with the individual movements to improve my muscle strength (the instructor does not tell you to do this..)- It is different.What I don't like:- The instructor actually talks to the camera and tells whoever is controlling it to come look from a different angle so we can understand what is going on...  this happens too late...- I can't do this workout by itself and consider it a workout.  For me, it probably has the same effect on me as a 45 minute walk.- I can't do this workout daily -- I loose interest.  I come back to it every week or so.

reviewText: This is by far the most difficult of the Samba Party workout videos, but also the most fun, I think.  Hardest, because there's a lot more choreography to absorb, and it's an hour as opposed to a half hour.  Funnest because there's a lot of cool moves.  I think Vanessa Isaac is an excellent teacher, because she makes it fun to learn the dance.

reviewText: I love this dvd I have many different workout dvds but this is one of the best, I like the way Vanessa teaches you the moves one by one instead of thowing 3 or 4 steps at you at the same time where you are more confused that ever. It is very easy to follow and so much fun and trust me you are going to sweat a lot!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is the sort of "break-your-neck-trying" at-home workout to be avoided by the beginner or those not in tiptop shape.  "Buyer Beware" because you could seriously hurt your knees or stress your heart trying to keep up with this challenging DVD.  This isn't coming from a couch slouch either.  I attend regular dance classes and was once a dancer.  I wish the workout came in different versions, for beginner, intermediate or advanced.  As a dancer I'd say this one is intermediate/advanced.  The plus side is that the teacher is engaging and dedicated to her dance form; she just needs to work harder on the teaching part.  The live drumming is great!  The solos are wonderful--a definite plus, to see so many different styles.  I like the fact that there are dancers of various ages, sizes, male and female.  I wish those dancers in the workout DVD who are heavier or older were directed to show modifications of the steps so the workout could be useful to various fitness levels, shapes and sizes.
summary: Buyer Beware--this is Fast, Fast, Fast!
Title: N/A

reviewText: As a non-dancer, she went a little too fast for me, but the DVD was still enjoyable to use and I'll be using it again -- it might even get into my regular rotation of exercise DVDs!The good:  Her background dancers had very varied body types (including two that were nearly overweight). One of the background dancers was a man, which was nice to see!  Most of my DVDs use only women background dancers.I loved the live music!  She had a band right there with her, and the camera cut to them now and then.  Fun to watch!I was happy that she kept us marching in place while she explained things.  Sure I could march on my own when an instructor doesn't tell us to, but I'm lazy, so I'd rather be told to do it.The bad things were minor: The DVD was really loud.  The music was loud, so she had to nearly shout to be heard; I had to turn the sound lower on my TV than I ever had before.And, as I mentioned, she moved a little fast. It was hard to see the new steps, to see how they were done, so even on the fifth time through I wasn't really doing them right... but even so, it was still fun to do!So all in all, I'd recommend this DVD!
summary: Hard time following it, but still enjoyed it
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD had great production, though mostly sticks to one camera angle, doing outside was a refreshing change & even has 1 guy also doing the moves. The live music is also a nice touch.I had a bit of trouble following along. She does it fast first to see, then half-pace 2x, then normal speed 2x. The adds a couple of moves after building to a big routine. There are a lot of moves that are slightly complex, but they are added together fast so take many viewings to keep up. About 70% of the damce moves wouldn't look good at a club, only on stage. The sumba realy worked my abs, fastest I'd ever done it.  All the dances are done VERY quick to fast tempo. She doens't give enough cues, just have to mostly rely on the slow 2x.There's a trailer at collagevideo com
summary: A bit fast-paced, some great moves
